net.cloud.gfx.elements.modal

Class ModalManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.modal.ModalManager

  • public class ModalManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The front-end and work center for modal dialog creation. Offers quick and easy ways of creating modal dialogs, doing much of the configuration and background effort. Also allows a calling thread to be blocked until input is received on the dialog. (Great for grabbing quick user input)
    In general, the methods will allow an outside call to request input from a modal dialog, and have that input returned to them via blocking behavior.

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static ModalManager instance()
        Obtain a reference to the singleton instance of the ModalManager class. This allows for convenient usage of modal dialog pop-up interfaces.
        Returns:
        A singleton reference

      • elementWithinModal

        public static boolean elementWithinModal(Element element)
        Check to see if the given element either is, or is a child on, the current modal dialog. If one does not exist, this will simply return false.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to check
        Returns:
        True if the given element is part of the modal dialog

      • showMessageDialog

        public void showMessageDialog(java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String message)
                       throws ModalException
        Show a message dialog on the root interface. The dialog will be centered, and placed within a draggable frame. It will be reasonably sized. This method will take care of adding the dialog to the interface and other background work. This method will block until the 'okay' button is clicked on the dialog.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to show on the frame
        message - The message to display
        Throws:
        ModalException - If the dialog could not be shown. Results will not be available in this situation.

      • showConfirmationDialog

        public boolean showConfirmationDialog(java.lang.String title,
                                      java.lang.String prompt)
                               throws ModalException
        Show a confirmation dialog on the root interface. The dialog will be centered, and placed within a draggable frame. It will be reasonably sized. This method will take care of adding the dialog to the interface and other background work. This method will block until a button is clicked on the dialog.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to show on the frame
        prompt - The message to display
        Returns:
        True if the user confirmed, false if they chose cancel
        Throws:
        ModalException - If the dialog could not be shown. Results will not be available in this situation.

      • showInputDialog

        public java.lang.String showInputDialog(java.lang.String title,
                                        java.lang.String prompt)
                                 throws ModalException
        Show an input dialog on the root interface. The dialog will be centered, and placed within a draggable frame. It will be reasonably sized. This method will take care of adding the dialog to the interface and other background work. This method will block until a button is clicked on the dialog.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to show on the frame
        prompt - The message to display
        Returns:
        The string of the user input, or null (InputDialog.CANCELED) if they canceled
        Throws:
        ModalException - If the dialog could not be shown. Results will not be available in this situation.

      • showInputDialog

        public java.lang.String showInputDialog(java.lang.String title,
                                        java.lang.String prompt,
                                        InputValidator<java.lang.String> inputValidator)
                                 throws ModalException
        Show an input dialog on the root interface. The dialog will be centered, and placed within a draggable frame. It will be reasonably sized. This method will take care of adding the dialog to the interface and other background work. This method will block until a button is clicked on the dialog. This variant will provide an input validator to check input before it is returned
        Parameters:
        title - The title to show on the frame
        prompt - The message to display
        inputValidator - Dependency-injected object to ensure input into the dialog is valid
        Returns:
        Validated user input, or null (InputDialog.CANCELED) if they canceled
        Throws:
        ModalException - If the dialog could not be shown. Results will not be available in this situation.

      • getCurrentModal

        public java.util.Optional<AbstractModalDialog> getCurrentModal()
        Obtain a reference to the current modal dialog, if there is one. The value is in an optional. There will only ever be on modal dialog at a time, and another cannot be registered until it is removed.
        Returns:
        The [possibly present] modal dialog currently registered

      • register

        public void register(AbstractModalDialog modal)
              throws ModalException
        Attempt to register a new modal dialog as the current modal dialog in the system. This will only fail if there is already another modal dialog registered. Otherwise, this does not check any of the other assumptions, such as requiring a parent, and does not take other actions, such as adding the dialog to the parent.
        Parameters:
        modal - The new modal dialog
        Throws:
        ModalException - If the dialog could not be registered

      • deregister

        public void deregister()
        Deregister the existing modal dialog. This does not take extra action, such as removing the dialog or clearing its resources. If there is no current modal dialog, nothing will happen.

      • displayDialog

        public void displayDialog(java.lang.String title,
                          Container<? super Element> parent,
                          AbstractModalDialog dialog)
                   throws ModalException
        Display the given dialog in a draggable frame with the given title. No listener will be attached to the dialog, so any various listeners must manually be attached (this means closing behavior must be manually handled outside of this call)
        Parameters:
        title - The title to put on the frame
        parent - The parent to add the dialog to
        dialog - The dialog to display
        Throws:
        ModalException - If the dialog could not be reliably shown

      • displayMessage

        public void displayMessage(java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Uses displayDialog to show a nonblocking message dialog on the root. If the call fails, a simple exception message will be logged.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to put on the frame
        message - The message to display

      • genericDialogStuff

        private <T> T genericDialogStuff(java.lang.String title,
                                 Container<? super Element> parent,
                                 AbstractModalDialog dialog,
                                 DialogListener<T> listener)
                          throws ModalException
        I seriously could not think of a name for this one. It takes the various generic steps needed for showing a dialogue. It will wrap the dialog in a draggable frame, put the dialog on screen, block until results are available, remove the dialog from the screen, and then return the result from the dialog.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the result from the dialog
        Parameters:
        title - The title that will be on the frame
        parent - The container that the dialog will be placed in
        dialog - The dialog itself
        listener - A listener that provides blocking and result obtaining functionality
        Returns:
        The coalesced result from the dialog, obtained via the listener
        Throws:
        ModalException - If results could not be reliably obtained

      • decoratedDialog

        private DraggableElement decoratedDialog(java.lang.String title,
                                         AbstractModalDialog dialog)
        Wrap a dialog in a frame which is then wrapped in a draggable element. This can only be dragged from the title of the frame.
        Parameters:
        title - The title that will be on the frame
        dialog - The dialog itself
        Returns:
        A DraggableElement wrapped around the dialog

      • showDialog

        private void showDialog(Container<? super Element> parent,
                        AbstractModalDialog dialog,
                        Element decorator)
                 throws ModalException
        First registers the dialog, and then adds it to the parent
        Parameters:
        parent - The container that the dialog will be placed in
        dialog - The dialog itself
        decorator - The decorator wrapping the dialog
        Throws:
        ModalException - Registration of the dialog failed

      • removeDialog

        private void removeDialog(Container<? super Element> parent,
                          Element decorator)
        First removes the dialog from the parent, then deregisters it
        Parameters:
        parent - The container that the dialog will be placed in
        decorator - The decorator wrapping the dialog
